label: 霾都狂徒 - 罪据确凿 Outlaws of Alkenstar - The Smoking Gun

The Smoking Gun.name: 罪证确凿 The Smoking Gun
The Smoking Gun.description: 复仇心切的义警们必须潜入阿肯斯塔的上流社会，掌握古老魔法与精密发条工程相结合的强大技能，并利用爆熔雷的巨大威力来阻止宿敌颠覆城市的阴谋。在这场充满动作的高潮中，团队成员将面临迄今为止最大的挑战。他们能否洗清冤屈，清算旧账？还是会被邪恶力量抢先一步？

The Smoking Gun.name: 罪证确凿 The Smoking Gun

Adventure Overview.name: 冒险概述
Adventure Overview.text:
罪证确凿 The Smoking Gun

Unlikely Heroes

在《霾都狂徒》冒险之路最后的高潮部分，主角们将发现自己不仅仅是英雄，而且是阿肯斯塔真正的救世主。考虑到主角们在故事开始时不太光彩的身份——寻求报仇的银行劫匪，因此这可能会让人感觉具有是戏剧一般的转折。

你的玩家们的性格和游戏风格显然会影响他们对这一命运转折的体验。当他们的角色在公众面前得到救赎时，有的玩家可能会松一口气。而另一些人则可能会希望保留他们来之不易的冷酷名声。

幸运的是，《罪证确凿》在最后几章中提供了各式各样的冒险动机。那些出于道德感想拯救阿肯斯塔的人可能不需要进一步的激励，而那些唯利是图的冒险者们也可以放心，他们的努力将得到丰厚的回报。此外，解决最终危机有助于帮角色解决一个自游戏开始就一直困扰着他们的核心问题：他们的通缉犯身份。女大公亲自承诺，如果队伍阻止了洛夫莱斯的阴谋，她将既往不咎。无论角色们打算如何使用即将到手的自由，任何人都很难否认，拥有一张清白的记录在霾都就代表着无尽的机遇。

第一章：军备竞赛

女大公崔莉塔·瑞希亚直接和主角们见面，解释说事情已经开始变得可怕起 来。为了找到@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18006advent.JournalEntryPage.06anjeliquelov00]{洛夫莱斯} 和爆熔雷的买家，队伍必须调查洛夫莱斯的指挥部——盾勋执法官的总部机密厅（Vault of Secrets），并救出那些因为对副警长的计划了解过多而遭到逮捕的阿肯斯塔市民。队伍找到的线索将他们引向了阿肯斯塔西边的@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18005thegun.JournalEntryPage.05thegunworks000]{枪械工坊} ，在那里他们将得知敌人准备用爆熔雷炸毁阿肯瀑布的阴谋。

第二章：急转直下

随着调查深入，主角们来到了阿肯瀑布（Alken Falls）附近的锡圈水厂（Tinwound Hydroforge），帕索斯利用死灵法术让净水厂里遍布不死仆从。队伍必须通过带电的亡灵、发条怪物和危险的科技产物，找到并击败帕索斯。帕索斯透露，洛夫莱斯和伊布里姆此刻正在一艘豪华的内河游轮上，带着爆熔雷向这里驶来。

第三章：喋血游轮

为了挽救局面，法外狂徒们登上了一艘名为“齿轮生烟”（Gearsmoke）的赌场游轮，这艘船正沿着乌斯塔迪河向阿肯斯塔市中心开去。这艘船上装满了极具挥发性的爆熔雷，所以队伍必须偷偷拆除炸弹，最后和洛夫莱斯以及伊布里姆正面对决，彻底颠覆恶棍们的阴谋。

冒险轨迹

《罪证确凿》是为 4 个主角设计的冒险。

8 队伍在冒险开始时应达到 8 级。

9 队伍在第二章开始前应达到 9 级。

10 队伍在第三章开始前应达到 10 级。

11 队伍在完成冒险后应该达到 11 级。

Cover.text:
霾都狂徒:罪证确凿

By Cole Kronewitter

一弹定乾坤

复仇心切的义警们必须潜入阿肯斯塔的上流社会，掌握古老魔法与精密发条工程相结合的强大技能，并利用爆熔雷的巨大威力来阻止宿敌颠覆城市的阴谋。在这场充满动作的高潮中，团队成员将面临迄今为止最大的挑战。他们能否洗清冤屈，清算旧账？还是会被邪恶力量抢先一步？《霾都狂徒》的冒险之路在“罪证确凿”中迎来结局，这是一场为8至10级角色设计的完整冒险。

Landing.text:
功能与支持

更改登录页面宏

@Macro[9CK1yodbcoSGYQ4y]{登录界面选择器}

您可以使用这些宏更改场景背景。

模块支持联系方式

https://support.metamorphic-digital.com/

若需报告此产品的错误或其他问题，请通过我们的服务台提交支持请求。

日志标记功能

日志已按需要固定在相应场景。

要始终显示固定的日志，请前往左侧边栏的“日志备注”工具，并点击紫色的“切换备注显示”按钮。

Changelog.text:
The Smoking Gun Changelog

12.0.0 v12 Release

  • Updated to v12 compatibility
  • added teleport regions
  • adjusted ambient sounds
  • updated roof tiles
  • improved some macros

2.0.4

  • clean up adventure importer styling
  • clean up Compendium folder colors
  • update loot token
  • remove door from the Tinwound Hydroforge
  • fix minor Journal issues

2.0.0

  • Updated all content for use with v11
  • fix name of Loy Ayton in Art gallery

1.2.3

  • Update for RWI importing

1.2.2

  • Add utility macro "Globally Toggle Roof Occlusion Mode" which can be used in order to see through roofs while having NPCs selected
  • Fixed issue with broken unlinked token actors
  • Fixed issue with broken variant actors

1.2.0

  • Updated all content for use with v10

1.0.1

  • Added: Visit the Art Gallery for central access to all of the stunning artworks in this Adventure Path!
  • Fixed: Soundscapes provided as ambient playlists and local sound sources to immerse your players, mixed using audio from the Syrinscape library.
  • Fixed: The Smoking Gun no longer requires users to also own and enable Punks in a Powderkeg

1.0.0 Initial Release

  • Nineteen completely remade, highly detailed, and immersive adventure maps with support for Foundry Virtual Tabletop's Overhead Tiles and Foreground Layer features, re-created by Sigil Entertainment Group using assets from Forgotten Adventures.
  • Journal Entries for the entire contents of the book with additional encounter notes and Foundry VTT tips.
  • Scenes pre-configured with walls, lights, sound, tokens, and hazards already placed to provide GMs the most convenient experience running the adventure.
  • High-resolution character artwork and tokens for the unique steampunk mutants and monsters in this AP
  • High-resolution, upscaled versions of the original maps.
  • Twentytwo Macros created to help run your adventure.

僵尸盛宴

作者：Mike Kimmel

当盖布的一家僵尸劳工农场出现问题时，新手故障排查员发现问题根深蒂固。帮派战争、陈年政治对立以及不死怪物将这些新晋代理人推向了考验。

在骨头覆盖的灰悲镇，人类与不死生物擦肩而过。探索这个小镇的众多场所和秘密！

盖布的大派系控制着这个不死国家的经济。学习如何在《血领主冒险路径》中利用它们的影响力！

Chapter 1: Arms Race.name: 第一章：军备竞赛 Arms Race

Chapter 1 Arms Race.name: 军备竞赛
Chapter 1 Arms Race.text:
Chapter 1: Arms Race

Chapter 1 Synopsis

在这次冒险开头，女大公崔莉塔·瑞希亚直接和主角们见面，解释说事情已经开始变得可怕起来。爆熔雷现在不仅仅掌握在队伍的死对头——副警长洛夫莱斯·安洁莉卡手中。当角色们在之前的冒险中打败穆格兰之前，他就已经把配方卖掉了。

在这一章中，角色们必须追踪行踪诡秘的洛夫莱斯副警长和爆熔雷的买家。要做到这一点，他们必须调查洛夫斯的指挥部——盾勋执法官的总部机密厅（Vault of Secrets），并救出那些因为对副警长的计划了解过多而遭到逮捕的阿肯斯塔市民。调查将他们带到了在这座城市最高的大楼之一举行的一场奢华晚宴上。他们将在这里遇到一些社会名流，这些社会名流可以引导他们挖掘洛夫莱斯的终极动机。

最后，主角们必须横穿城市，去解救那些被洛夫莱斯追杀的市民。他们来到了城外著名的枪械制造厂——枪械工坊。在这里，队伍必须赢得驻军指挥官的信任，解决神秘的问题、保护枪械工坊免受法力废土部落的突袭。与此同时，一场法力风暴正在肆虐。

在上一次冒险的最后，主角们终于完成了对恶毒大亨安布罗斯特·穆格兰的复仇。尽管如此，他们中的一些人可能依然对副警长 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18006advent.JournalEntryPage.06anjeliquelov00]{安洁莉卡·洛夫莱斯},怀恨在心。自从法外狂徒们第一次组队行动，她的阴谋诡计就一直是队伍的眼中钉肉中刺。而且，爆熔雷落入了比穆格兰更危险的人的手中。@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18006advent.JournalEntryPage.06parsus00000000]{帕索斯} 和 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18006advent.JournalEntryPage.06ibrium00000000]{伊布里姆}，这两位分别来自盖布和奈克斯的强大施法者，出于自己的神秘目标购买了爆熔雷的配方。洛夫莱斯是唯一一个知晓买家信息的人。随着秘密被彻底泄露，阿肯斯塔的当权者——女大公崔莉塔·瑞希亚担心，爆熔雷的秘密扩散到整个内海可能只是时间问题。

瑞希亚不知道的是，洛夫莱斯已经和帕索斯和伊布里姆沆瀣一气，制造了大量的爆熔雷。他们计划炸毁阿肯瀑布，摧毁阿肯斯塔严密监控的升船机系统——螺钉。在计划中，他们将在阿肯斯塔大公国播撒混乱，并创建一条新的、更快的水上航路，让军队和货物能更方便快捷地穿过法力废土。

对于这个邪恶的阴谋，一个显而易见的问题是：为什么？

伊布里姆和帕索斯知道，如果两国再次爆发战争，那么沿着乌斯塔迪河能有一条更快速的运输路线的话对双方都是无价的，而且他们还能从边境的赞助商手里获得丰厚的利润。即便奈克斯和盖布之间的战争没有爆发，他们至少可以验证一下自己新购买的大规模杀伤性武器的真实效能。

对于洛夫莱斯来说，这位扭曲的副警长一直渴望在盾勋执法官的等级体系中获得更大的权力，而事态的发展为她提供了一个能够掌握她所谓“应得的权力”的绝佳机会。到目前为止，她所有的权力争夺都因（合法的）腐败指控而受阻。但是，如果一场毁灭性的爆炸摧毁了城市的根基，那么就几乎没有人会反对设立更强大、更严格的盾勋执法官的法案，而这项法案恰好可以让她获得权力。如果一切按照洛夫莱斯的计划进行，强制征兵将成为阿肯斯塔的常态，她将以将军的身份领导这支新的盾勋执法官军队。拥有如此强大的武力之后，她就可以决定阿肯斯塔的命运。

Getting Started.name: 冒险开始 Getting Started
Getting Started.text:
The previous adventure, “Cradle of Quartz,” ended with the characters finally exacting their revenge on Ambrost Mugland. After hearing the news, Foebe Dunsmith asks the characters to meet at the Barrel & Bullet Saloon just before dawn the following day to discuss the future of pyronite and Alkenstar. When they arrive, Dunsmith escorts the characters to a back room, where they find a mysterious figure waiting.

Scene NotesFoundry

@Macro[cDWynEHKfSXC1NUI]{Sound Clockwork Waltz}

Macro: You can click on the macro above to play a special track.

This macro will play the "Clockwork Waltz" music, which we thought would fit with the encounter with the grand duchess herself.

A black ten-gallon hat rests on a table near the back of the room. Behind the hat sits a woman wearing unassuming, yet fine, clothes embroidered with the crest of Alkenstar.

With a deferential bow and a murmur of, “My lady,” Foebe Dunsmith closes the door, ensuring this meeting is private.

Rising from her seat, Grand Duchess Trietta Ricia dons her hat and leans over the table. She arches an eyebrow before speaking. “Agent Dunsmith has kept me appraised of your efforts regarding the pyronite situation. I’d hoped the trail might end with Mugland, but it seems Deputy Loveless is still at large with the pyronite formula, along with two new faces—wizards from Geb and Nex named Parsus and Ibrium, respectively. Obviously, the implications of this discovery are dire.

“Pyronite is too powerful a weapon for one nation to wield alone,” Ricia continues. “If the formula can’t be kept secret here in Alkenstar, I fear it must be spread to all nations equally. The political situation between Nex and Geb is tenuous, to say nothing of nations more distant from Alkenstar. If any single power were to gain access to pyronite, they would gain a devastating advantage in matters of war. To prevent this, I’ve begun preparations to distribute the pyronite formula to as many foreign powers as necessary, including the hands of unscrupulous nations close to home such as Nex and Geb. Take a moment to let that set in.”

Ricia paces the room slowly and speaks methodically. “With all nations ensured equal access to this new weapon, the current balance of power will be preserved. At the moment, my hands are tied and the world will be forever changed because of Gattlebee’s devastating invention.”

She stops pacing and looks up from the floor. “There’s still a small chance to avoid this, however. If you can find Loveless, Parsus, and Ibrium, you could prevent the formula from spreading further. This is my preferred solution by far. Obviously, Alkenstar would be in a far safer position if no one—or, at least, only our own nation—had access to this powerful new weapon.”

Ricia gauges the characters’ reaction to her news and offers to answer any questions they might have. The following are a few of the party’s most likely questions, along with Ricia’s replies.

Where do we start looking? “At present, we know little about Parsus or Ibrium, so the trail ends with Loveless, who’s also nowhere to be found. While we don’t know their plans, in order to use the pyronite formula, the trio will need large quantities of the necessary reagents to craft the explosives. This means they need funding, material, transportation—all things that can be tracked. As a first step, I need you to infiltrate the Ironmaster’s Vault of Secrets, where Loveless and her cronies have their offices. Hopefully, you can find some clues there.” Dunsmith can provide the party with more info about the Vault of Secrets after the grand duchess departs (see @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01intothevault00]{here}).

Why us? Shouldn’t Alkenstar’s best be working on this? “Loveless has many allies, both high and low, who’ve already stymied my official efforts. Even aside from the risk of alerting Loveless to our plans, Alkenstar’s bureaucracy is... formidable. Our city is like a lumbering engine set on a track: it’s difficult to slow down and even more difficult to change directions. For nimble adjustments, I’ve found unorthodox solutions—such as agents like you—are far more effective. So far your efforts have been outstanding, which is why I’ve selected you for this important mission.”

What’s in it for us? “Apart from averting an international disaster and saving Alkenstar? Money, of course. Reputation, for another—or should I say ‘redemption’? Let me put it simply: if you’re successful, I will personally ensure you’re amply rewarded. Moreover, my political powers are significant. For complying with my requests, I can absolve you of the laws you’ve thus far broken, including any damage to your status Mugland or Loveless may have inflicted. I can also help you out of binds in the future—within reason, of course.”

Once she’s answered all of their questions, Grand Duchess Ricia excuses herself and leaves Dunsmith to discuss the particulars of the party’s mission.

Shieldmarshal Bullpen.text:
A2. 执法官办公区 Shieldmarshal Bullpen

这个房间里摆满了桌子，通常在这里办公的都是洛夫莱斯 @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18006advent.JournalEntryPage.06anjeliquelov00]{洛夫莱斯} 的亲信。目前这座办公大厅里没有人。
Shieldmarshal Bullpen.name: 执法官办公室

Into the Vault of Secrets.name: 进入秘密金库
Into the Vault of Secrets.text:
The party’s first step toward finding Loveless, Dunsmith explains, is to infiltrate the Vault of Secrets—a secret underground fortress from which Alkenstar’s shieldmarshals operate. The Vault has several entrances, all known only to vetted shieldmarshals and national defense bureaucrats. Luckily, Dunsmith and Ricia have arranged a way for the characters to gain access to one of these entrances. Dunsmith outlines the characters’ mission as follows.

  • Hijack the stagecoach. From time to time, shieldmarshals act as armed escorts for Alkenstar, transporting government cargo across the harsh wasteland outside the city walls. An armored stagecoach accompanied by four shieldmarshals is scheduled to return from the town of Martel later this afternoon. To gain access to the Vault of Secrets, the characters will need to sneak aboard the stagecoach, either by stowing away or staging a stickup. The stagecoach is pulled by a pair of mindless clockwork steeds programmed to take the coach into the Vault of Secrets regardless of who’s aboard.
  • Find info on Loveless. Once the characters are inside the Vault, they can collect info on Loveless. Dunsmith suggests they keep an eye out for suspicious paperwork which might indicate Loveless’s whereabouts, her most recent dealings with Alkenstar power brokers, or the names of potential accomplices.
  • Escape undetected. The Vault of Secrets is crawling with shieldmarshals, both good and bad. Fighting their way out simply isn’t an option. “I’ve no doubt you can handle a few of Loveless’s goons,” Dunsmith says, “but don’t stick around any longer than you have to. Escape the way you came, and don’t look back.”

Dunsmith is able to provide a few additional details about the stagecoach. It’s crewed by four shieldmarshals; two, named Otto and Lillie, are toughened warriors believed to be associated with Loveless and capable of putting up a real fight. The other two, Payton and Oakley, are shieldmarshal bookkeepers responsible for auditing, managing the Vault stockpiles, and other financial affairs—these two are unlikely to be involved in Loveless’s schemes, and so Dunsmith asks the characters to refrain from using lethal force against them.

Many of Loveless’s lower-level lackeys have taken to wearing pins or getting tattoos that depict a broken heart to signify to other shieldmarshals they enjoy the fearsome deputy’s favor and protection. Once the characters are inside the vaults, they should keep an eye out for any shieldmarshals matching this description, then tail them to Loveless’s offices if they can’t locate them on their own. Loveless and her closest minions operate out of Vault 14, which should be right next to the hangar where the stagecoach stops.

Event 1: Stagecoach Heist.name: 事件 1: 马车劫案 Stagecoach Heist
Event 1: Stagecoach Heist.text:
The stagecoach Dunsmith described arrives at Alkenstar from Martel shortly after noon, entering the city in the Ferrous Quarter and rambling through the streets to a warehouse in Steamhaven. This unassuming brick warehouse contains a secret elevator down to the infamous Vault of Secrets.

The characters are free to stage their heist anywhere along the stagecoach’s route. Built to transport heavy cargo, the steel-sided stagecoach is 10 feet wide, 15 feet long, and pulled by two powerful clockwork steeds. If necessary, you can use the vehicle rules from the Pathfinder Gamemastery Guide; use the stats for an @Compendium[pf2e.vehicles.WjOkOaWOGkLmuSq5]{Armored Carriage} for the stagecoach.

Event 1 Stagecoach HeistLow 8

@Compendium[pf2e.outlaws-of-alkenstar-bestiary.RpGReUxsaT8wCz2u]{Corrupt Shieldmarshals (2)}

The Coach Heist: To approach the stagecoach without being spotted, at least half the characters must succeed at a @Check[stealth|dc:25] check or @Check[deception|dc:25|traits:action:create-a-diversion] check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}. Once they’re close, the characters can break into the stagecoach with four successful @Check[thievery|dc:25] checks or cling to the underside of the stagecoach with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:25] check. Finally, the characters also have the option of a simple stickup: it takes three successful @Check[intimidation|dc:25] checks to get Otto and Lillie to lay down their arms. In the event of combat, the two shieldmarshals defend the top of the carriage while Payton and Oakley attempt to flee and get help.

Creatures: While traveling through dangerous territory such as the city outskirts, Payton and Oakley sit on a bench at the front of the stagecoach steering the steeds, while Otto and Lillie ride atop the stagecoach’s roof, which is fortified by a low wall for cover. Once they reach the safety of Alkenstar however, the two drivers reprogram the clockwork steeds to charge ahead on auto-pilot. Likewise, Otto and Lillie holster their guns and lounge on the roof, chit-chatting. Stat blocks aren’t provided for Payton and Oakley, as these two shieldmarshals are clerical workers and aren’t trained for combat. For Otto and Lillie, as well as many of Loveless’s other lackeys, use the above stat block.

Aftermath: However the party boards or follows the stagecoach, the clockwork steeds automatically take the vehicle straight to a dingy warehouse in Steamhaven. The carriage pulls into a clockwork freight elevator that, with a screeching of gears, lowers down into @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01carriagehang00]{area A1} in the Vault of Secrets below.

XP Award: If the characters sneak aboard or stick up the stagecoach without causing a fight, award each character 60 XP as if they’d overcome a combat encounter.

Loveless’s Offices.name: 洛夫莱斯的办公室
Loveless’s Offices.text:
The Ironmaster’s Vault of Secrets is a sprawling underground complex divided up into a large number of interconnected vaults and hangars. The shieldmarshals use these chambers as offices, holding cells, armories, and storage rooms. Now that they’re inside, the characters need to find their way into Loveless’s office to search for clues. The immediate areas they can explore are described below; these descriptions correspond to the Vault of Secrets map on the inside front cover of this volume. The vault sprawls far beyond what’s shown on the map, but the characters needn’t explore the facility any further than this section. The ceilings in this area are 15 feet high, and the rooms are all illuminated by oil lamps.

If the characters seriously bungle the operation and manage to raise a full alarm, groups of three @Compendium[pf2e.outlaws-of-alkenstar-bestiary.CNFAfmVoVebnj7bY]{Shieldmarshals} arrive in @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01carriagehang00]{area A1} every 6 rounds until the characters either escape or are apprehended.

Carriage Hangar.name: 马车车库
Carriage Hangar.text:
A1. Carriage Hangar

When the characters first descend the elevator, they’re deposited in this small loading area reserved for armored stagecoaches. The clockwork steeds automatically park the stagecoach and the four shieldmarshals (if able and unaware of the characters’ presence) exit the vehicle and walk away from the hangar, leaving the characters alone. From time to time, groups of shieldmarshals walk through this area. A door labeled “Vault 14” stands along the southeast wall, marking the party’s destination. The door north of that one is labeled “Vault 15.”

Loveless's Office.name: 洛夫莱斯的办公室
Loveless's Office.text:
A3. Loveless’s Office

Two large glass windows look out from this room to the bullpen outside, allowing Loveless to glare at her subordinates. A large desk stands in the center of the room, with two chairs sitting in front of it. As befits a deputy so exacting, Loveless’s office is organized with meticulous precision.

Shieldmarshal Offices.name: 执法官办公室
Shieldmarshal Offices.text:
A4. Shieldmarshal Offices

These two offices belong to Loveless’s closest allies and confidants, Skedra and Thorne. In stark contrast to their captain’s tidy office, Skedra and Thorne have stacks of papers piling their desks, along with drawers full of misplaced evidence and pilfered trinkets.

Vault 15 Offices.name: 15 厅办公室
Vault 15 Offices.text:
A5. Vault 15 Offices

The rooms in this area mirror areas @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha00]{A2} through @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha01]{A4} in terms of layout and furniture. Vault 15 is another division of the shieldmarshals, run by a man named Braye Braisley. Braisley and his reports are completely ignorant of the corruption festering in the vault next door. Currently, six shieldmarshals are working in this area.

Event 2: Getting the Goods.name: 事件 2: 收集物证 Getting the Goods
Event 2: Getting the Goods.text:
Once they’ve entered the Vault of Secrets, the characters need to search areas @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha00]{A2}, @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01lovelesssoff01]{A3}, and @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha01]{A4} for clues. To do this, they must sift through stacks of logbooks and official documents by attempting a @Check[society|dc:25] or @Check[accounting-lore|dc:25]{Accounting Lore}, @Check[legal-lore|dc:25]{Legal Lore}, or @Check[underworld-lore|dc:25]{Underworld Lore} Lore check. For each successful check, a character discovers one of the leads below.

  • Christia Tombend: A tattered day log indicates Loveless has met with a wealthy Alkenstar benefactor named Christia Tombend on many occasions. Tombend is hosting a gathering at her flat in Graeson’s Fingers tomorrow, and the day log contains invitations to the event.
  • Rhangyl Foruza: An auspicious newspaper clipping stands out amid Loveless’s things. According to the article, a local river merchant named Rhangyl Foruza was captured by the shieldmarshals and is scheduled for public hanging in 2 days’ time.
  • Dash: Loveless’s minions have been searching for a cattle rustler named Dash, a known associate of the aforementioned Rhangyl Foruza. So far, however, the shieldmarshals haven’t been able to find the elusive rancher.

After 1 round of searching, loud footsteps echo through the hall in area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01carriagehang00]{A1}, alerting the characters that someone is approaching. If they want to sneak out of the vault undetected, they need to find the remaining clues fast! The characters have 2 more rounds to search, after which the door to area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha00]{A2} opens. At this point, the party can’t continue searching without being detected, so they need to find some way to deal with the newcomers.

Creatures: When the door opens, read or paraphrase the following.

With a loud squeal, the vault door swings open and a uniformed shieldmarshal steps into the room, accompanied by four burly dwarves wearing dark suits and bowler hats.

“Alright, boys,” the shieldmarshal says, “Loveless wants us to get rid of anything that might raise questions before the big show. Let’s get cleaning.”

Event 2: Getting the GoodsModerate 8

@Compendium[pf2e.outlaws-of-alkenstar-bestiary.c1v4Xb3x6nvpFmth]{Atticus} @Compendium[pf2e.outlaws-of-alkenstar-bestiary.zNlQRFJcijptkQQ4]{Leadsmiths (4)}

The shieldmarshal is a Loveless lackey named Atticus, whose hat prominently displays a broken heart pin. A character who makes a successful @Check[society|dc:22|traits:action:recall-knowledge] check to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} identifies the four toughs as Leadsmiths, private detectives and mercenaries who serve Alkenstar’s wealthy. The leader of the Leadsmiths is a fearsome cyclops gunslinger named Vewslog, though he isn’t present at this time. Loveless knows that agents of the grand duchess are aware of her plans, so she’s hired the Leadsmiths to clean up her back trail, removing any clues that might make her look bad along the way.

If the characters are still in the room when Atticus and the Leadsmiths arrive, use encounter mode to determine everyone’s movements round by round. Unless the characters are being exceptionally noisy or purposefully standing out, the interlopers don’t immediately notice them. Atticus and the Leadsmiths fan out and begin rifling through papers, starting on the north end of area @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha00]{A2} and then moving into the northern hallway to check out the areas marked @UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18001armsra.JournalEntryPage.01shieldmarsha01]{A4}. If the characters are patient and careful, they might be able to sneak by the group without ever revealing their presence. This requires each member of the party to succeed at a Stealth or Deception check against the Perception DC of the nearest enemy. If any characters are spotted, the Leadsmiths attack at once.

Though he thinks highly of himself, Atticus is totally in the dark about Loveless’s actual plans. He’s been calling her scheme “the big show,” but beyond vague promises that Atticus will serve as one of the lieutenants of Loveless’s grand army, the deputy has given her stooge no information of real value.

Treasure: @Actor[byXT4FBN9sOvjHJ9]{Shieldmarshal Office}

The corrupt shieldmarshals have hidden some useful loot within their offices, including one dose of lich dust, an invisibility rune, two lawbringer’s lassos, and a single firearm round of explosive ammunition.

XP Award: If the characters recover the clues and sneak out without battling the Leadsmiths, award each character 90 XP.

Stairs.name: 楼梯 Stairs
Stairs.text:
D10. 楼梯 Stairs

这里的楼梯向上蜿蜒 20 尺，到达建筑楼顶的 D11 区域。位于楼梯上的主角可以透过巨大的绿色玻璃窗窥视D8区域，@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18002alkens.JournalEntryPage.02themachining00]{D8},但重度着色的玻璃会导致查看房间内的察觉检定有-4 减值。 （译注：应该是环境）

Electric Pillars.name: 电极柱 Electric Pillars
Electric Pillars.text:
D11. 电极柱

十根柱子，每根柱子上都缠绕着金属线圈，在水厂的屋顶以两列均匀的方式隔开。电光在柱子之间随意跳跃，蔚蓝的光芒照亮了周围石雕。不断闪光的电火花跳到悬挂在柱子之间的巨大金属轨道上。这些金属轨道由巨大的钢柱支撑，从屋顶穿过河流，进入城市。十根巨大的金属电缆从每根电极柱的底部伸出，连接至屋顶地板上的金属井盖。

区域@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18002alkens.JournalEntryPage.02maintenances00]{D5}的电缆通向屋顶，最终接入这里的 10 根电极柱。通过复杂的技术，这些柱子放大了电力，并将其传导至金属导轨中。电力沿着这条轨道被输送到阿肯斯塔的主要建筑物里。这个系统虽然有效，但是维护起来非常昂贵，并且传输距离也不够长，这使得水厂创造的奇迹至今无法传播到阿肯斯塔之外。

D11. 电极柱适中 9

@Compendium[pf2e.outlaws-of-alkenstar-bestiary.SuFVqL1LRxsGWB1B]{带电丧尸 (6)}

危害：正常情况下，在控制室（@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18002alkens.JournalEntryPage.02controlroom000]{D17}区域）内工作的工程师会定期调整电极柱的输出，以消散多余的能量。随着所有工程师死亡，楼顶已经积蓄了一周多的危险能量，在电极柱之间形成了巨大的电弧。当主角们开始探索屋顶时，为屋顶上的每个格子分配一个数字，从 1 到 10。在每轮开始时，投掷 2d10；你掷出的数字所代表的两根柱子之间会发出一条直线电弧，对路径上所有生物造成 7d6 电击伤害（DC 28 基础反射豁免）。如果掷出的两个数字相同，则该轮不会形成电弧。

此外，电能导轨也非常危险，尽管它安全地悬在距离地面 20 尺的地方。接触到它的生物会立即受到 20d6 电击伤害 (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save) ，因为致命的电流会穿过他的身体。

生物：该区域已经证明是帕索斯的一部分不死机械造物的天然乐园。六只@UUID[JournalEntry.pf2ap18006advent.JournalEntryPage.06shockzombie000]{带电丧尸}悬挂在柱子之间的轨道上，尽情享受经过身体的大量电流。当主角们靠近时，丧尸会下降发起攻击。

宝藏： @Actor[KSjOAoABvup1c4MA]{无头尸体}

水厂的首席工程师的无头尸体就躺在这里。丧尸们在最初的攻击中杀死了她。她的身体上依然穿着一套斥电鳗皮（electric eelskin）。
